review: no

description: Travel across Europe as king of the road, a trucker who delivers important cargo across impressive distances! With dozens of cities to explore, your endurance, skill and speed will all be pushed to their limits.
name: Euro Truck Simulator 2
review: God this game could be so much more than it is. There seems to be a massive gap in quality in major areas of the game. The attention to detail on trucks and their interiors is absolutely fantastic, probably 3D scanned down to the millimetre. Meanwhile, every city is literally 3 intersections with a cardboard cutout of a famous building (so no actual city-driving to be found here), there's about 10 different types of non-truck car on the road, the only mix-ups in gameplay you find are randomly closed exits and 1 lane being closed for construction. It all feels like the focus of the game was put into adding a million tiny DLCs for new areas and truck customisation. Meanwhile every single quick-job is the exact same thing; pull out of this lot, drive on a highway, park it in a different lot. Why aren't there some unique objectives, like "take this construction equipment to this point on the map where there's construction" or "try and navigate this awkward trailer along narrow, sloped city streets"? It gets boring quickly and just doesn't change in the slightest as you progress. Progression is just longer routes and different things strapped to the back of your truck. Maybe the game's just outdated at this point.... but it's still getting updates to this day! Can't some of these updates go towards actually expanding the gameplay, instead of just expanding further and further east on the map?

description: Travel across Europe as king of the road, a trucker who delivers important cargo across impressive distances! With dozens of cities to explore, your endurance, skill and speed will all be pushed to their limits.
name: Euro Truck Simulator 2
review: A high beep while driving at the engine sound. Sounds like a dental drill.

description: Travel across Europe as king of the road, a trucker who delivers important cargo across impressive distances! With dozens of cities to explore, your endurance, skill and speed will all be pushed to their limits.
name: Euro Truck Simulator 2
review: I feel like I have to be a party-pooper, giving a negative review. I don't feel the sense of accomplishment with this game that I would expect. The game works, and it presents a calm environment to enjoy doing what you normally wouldn't. I'd compare it to playing an idle game that you also can enjoy for its own reasons. So while the games mechanics as such are solid, there's a few issues with the game: - The distances on the map are shortened massively, and as a consequence time itself is accelerated accordingly. While for the end result itself this might not be an issue, even bigger drives across Europe don't take too long. Crossing a country like France passes in a heartbeat. I would have liked the distances to be shorter on the map, but more "realistic" (still shrunk, but not to this degree). I'd feel happier if the base game contained the Benelux Countries and expanded from there. - The detail of the road network is quite poor. Country-specific detail isn't there at all (e.g. highway exits), and the roads feel very gemeric. Also, the cities could be bigger, giving a bigger challenge navigating the truck (see the point above). The only exciting thing I encountered was driving backwards with a trailer before concluding a mission. After a handful of drives, this factor wore off though, leaving me behind with no real motivation. TL;DR: This game is good if you're looking for a relaxing game. If you need some purpose or challenge (like I do), look for something else. Microsoft Flight Simulator X might be something similar to consider then as it adds more challenge navigating and operating your "vehicle".

description: Travel across Europe as king of the road, a trucker who delivers important cargo across impressive distances! With dozens of cities to explore, your endurance, skill and speed will all be pushed to their limits.
name: Euro Truck Simulator 2
review: 244.7 hours of play and my profile is suddenly gone. There's no file in the Documents folder and even though cloud save was enabled, it's just gone.

description: Travel across Europe as king of the road, a trucker who delivers important cargo across impressive distances! With dozens of cities to explore, your endurance, skill and speed will all be pushed to their limits.
name: Euro Truck Simulator 2
review: Been playing this game since it was released. I experienced so many updates which were unnecessary and almost had no effect on playing enjoyment, except new maps and the roads. And still those silly small updates keep coming since there is a huge absurdity going on like having full summer days (!) all around Europe. I waited for so long hoping that this issue will be covered by SCS as it is an obvious irrationality. I dont know if it is only me who is bothered by this but personally it started to become more and more frustrating for me to have the fixed weather conditions everywhere. (Actually only one!) Is it really very difficult to have seasonal changes in the game? I am not a game maker and i dont know anything about that but it should not be a rocket science for SCS to set it up. I personally would like to see some snow (at least in Scandinavia or some part of Russia) rather than receiving graphic based updates every three months which makes it harder and harder for my humble pc to run the game.

description: Travel across Europe as king of the road, a trucker who delivers important cargo across impressive distances! With dozens of cities to explore, your endurance, skill and speed will all be pushed to their limits.
name: Euro Truck Simulator 2
review: One of the best truck games I've ever played but still a negative review because despite massive success and lots of $$$ you never bothered to improve some core gameplay things like traffic to make it more realistic. Instead you left these things to the modders who basically work for you for free to make your game better so you could make even more money. And not to mention that the game looks and feels very outdated.

description: Travel across Europe as king of the road, a trucker who delivers important cargo across impressive distances! With dozens of cities to explore, your endurance, skill and speed will all be pushed to their limits.
name: Euro Truck Simulator 2
review: Would like more in game challenges, game is bit boring. More career stuff, would like more involvment in trucker game. Game need different enviroment like trucking timber trucks in forest and loading and unloading cargo! Right now this game is too boring but have great potential to be the greatest truck game of all time if they include more stuff in the game to do. I bought this game and im bored, because i have too little options in game. When we will get ownable cistern trailers?!? This game need more trailer customs. But right now i dont recommend this game.

description: The only aim in Rust is to survive. Everything wants you to die - the island’s wildlife and other inhabitants, the environment, other survivors. Do whatever it takes to last another night.
name: Rust
review: This was easily one of the most fun games I had in my entire library! Building and raiding bases, trolling nakeds and getting trolled by nakeds... complete with one of the most toxic player base I've played with and against.... would definitely recommend!! But then 11 days after investigating reported hackers on my community server (Grimlock Gaming), Steam notified me that I was banned from Rust. As per EAC's totally 100% accurate system, I was using "3rd Party Software" (on my own community server - a server where I'm the admin... and owner... which btw already contained all the admin tools I needed to assist in identifying hackers). I appealed (obviously) but was told that they (EAC) are totally 100% accurate, I was a bad boy and the ban will not be lifted. I contacted them again but received no response. I contacted Facepunch twice and was told that they totally trust EAC's totally 100% accurate system and to get lost. I have sent EAC numerous emails, logged a number of tickets... and even created a Reddit post (which the admin quickly deleted) and they still refuse to investigate my case. It's now 240+ days since my ban and I've officially given up! I've lost quite a few bucks on this game; skins, 3 (or more) gifts, two community servers... I cannot recommend a game where the devs offer no support whatsoever. Lesson learned!! Buy at your own risk

description: The only aim in Rust is to survive. Everything wants you to die - the island’s wildlife and other inhabitants, the environment, other survivors. Do whatever it takes to last another night.
name: Rust
review: After 3700 hours and playing since just after legacy, I have to say that I can no longer recommend this game to anyone. The cheating has completely ruined this game. You can join a random server and inspect the steam profiles of random players on that server, and 3/4 of them have some form of ban, or brag about cheating on their account. Rust has been one of my all time favorite games, but over the last few years while Facepunch has been adding more and more amazing content, the player base has become worse and worse. Now-a-days you're more likely to run into a person that will scream profanities, slurs, or just be a blatant cheater. They don't even try to hide it anymore... If FP would address the cheating, I would be back in a heartbeat, but until then... STAY AWAY. My last play session went like this: Watch a ShadowFrax update video and get excited about the upcoming holiday event. Join a random server so I can get some BP's prior to the holiday event starting. Spawn on the beach in the pitch black. Get headshot with a tommy from 100m out - has game ban on account. Respawn Find a metal hatchet and start gathering wood. Get aimbotted on by some random bow player - multiple vac bans on steam account. Notice most of the players on said server have bans of some form. Switch servers. Spawn and run down the beach at night. Notice a silhouette of a player up the hill from me, (as I was down hill and out of ear shot, there was NO WAY they could have seen or heard me) and when they look in my direction they instantly double headshot me in the moonless pitch black night - multiple game bans on their account. Uninstall...

description: The only aim in Rust is to survive. Everything wants you to die - the island’s wildlife and other inhabitants, the environment, other survivors. Do whatever it takes to last another night.
name: Rust
review: The issue I have with the game, is by far, its community. DISCLAIMER: This review is old, and as such does not reflect the game in its current state. I have been notified that apparently substantial changes have been made to the game. These changes might have fixed a lot of the issues that were inherent ot Rust, especially community based ones. But I myself am unable to confirm this as University and studies are taking up more and more of my time and as such i am unable to actually recheck any of my above statements. WANT A PREVIEW WATCH STIMPEE AND MEMEIO ON YT DISCLAIMER 2:for those unsure what this review is. The game contrasted with Vallheim shows the issue of a lack of PVE elements where the E is dangerous. That is just a fact. Want a co-op game do that. Rust is a PVP game with survival elements. DO NOT CONFUSE RUST WITH A SURVIVAL GAME. RUST IS A PVP GAME WITH BASE BUILDING AND SURVIVAL ELEMENTS. THIS REVIEW IS FROM SOMEONE WHO BOUGHT THE GAME EXPECTING A SURVIVAL GAME. PROS: -Intense survival experience, you are a mortal in a dangerous world - Initially cold, hunger and thirst are real threats. - The graphics can be very pretty, if you can run them. - Sounds are nice, gun shots ring out and pierce the still air. - Building is interesting and fun. - exploration is interesting and the blueprint system is pretty fun. CONS: - The community tends to be absolute garbage *Expanded at the bottom* - Servers tend to be immediatly taken over by massive constuctions, and sometimes clans immediatly dominate. - Resources become scarce pretty damn quickly - Animals run up sheer cliffs and can be quite glitchy - No costomizability *this is very minor* - KOS; COD style. -Optimization, my decent rig constantly overheats if I don't put my fans into hyperdrive; manually. NOW TO EXPLAIN: The community is simply cancer. If you are neaked and a geared trooper sees you, you can almost bet that he is going to shoot you for no reason. The excuse is; this is PVP, and that you ar a potential danger, or even "Just like in real life" Well here is the issue, KOS is not very real life, BUT the game is silent, it is dead when you move around. The only thing to break the silence is gunshots, some screeming from what is usually a poor helpless naked that has just barely managed to get his 2.5k wood to start his shack. Even when he makes his shack, instead of negotiating forming an alliance, this player is eliminated, his base raided for little to no resources and as such he has to start all over and the raider gets the thrill of raiding an offline 2 by 2 shack. This is all due to a KOS mentality that is so far from survival mentality that it is in reality COD mentality. The game runs like this: 1) Spawn, get materials build a small base 2) get blueprints and start gettign ready to wreck some anus 3) establish dominance in your area 4) Once dominance is established with your little posse build a massive unraidable castle 5) dominate the area and consume all resources, killing anyone you see for the fun of it, because you are now bored. 6) Make four excuses : "Git Gud" , "Become like us" , "Everyone is a threat, therefore I can KOS because I feel like it" , "Man salty nakeds" I once managed to get a small group going, immediatly a small but well armed clan emerged from their base and began hunting nakeds, just because. We had just managed to make a bow for one of us, when they emerged from the trees and just sprayed into us, killing all 5, and screaming through their mics that we suck and to "git Gud". This behaviour has slowly but surely been spreading throughout the entire community because it is the best way to play. Kill everyone, steal their resources, build yourself. It's also pointless. It makes the game a ghost town. Not but one year ago the servers were full of new players. Now the servers I usually play on barely peak over 1/2 the population, most of those being either clans or KOS' ers. It is sad to see such a great game go to waste because of the community, the only break from this is RP servers and PVE servers. RP servers maintain that PVP aspect, but give it a nice twist where KOS is rerely an option as each side has quite a lot to loose and tensions get higher than ever, whereas with KOS its usually just a naked dropping dead every so often. Sometimes clans will clash and then everything looks great. But those occurences are rare. The community needs to change if the game is going to ever survive, and in fact, thrive. I would suggest implementing a system like unturned has. You cannot hide weapons in your quickbar, either you have a tool to quick draw or a weapon, and then everyone can see how well armed you are, as well as add some strategic depth to the game. Also make nature more intense, make the PVE aspect even more challanging, its apparently post nuclear time, some strange shit ought to be walking around. It would add a nice threat to well geared players and well give nakeds a nicer start as they are suddenly not the primary target for shits and giggles. There also needs to be benefits to living a peaceful life, and benefits to living a violent one, and each needs its downsides. Right now violence is the only solution, pitifully so. Your chances of going out and finding a place to survive peacefully is nigh impossible (This is vital as you have no means to fight back effectively unless you are a god at PVP, you need time and space to build up otherwise clans are mandatory or just a willingness to grind and be online 24/7). Especially when these massive bases make their rise. The only person rading such a base is another person with a similar base, and even then they will probably fail, and require a clan. KOS is simply not beneficial in any way, and it is in fact detrimental. It simply takes away any real purpose in playing solo, and in fact makes random encounters and random party forming... impossible. KOS should remain firmly in the realm of FPS shooters, COD and Battlefield. Not survival games where you shoot at non threats because you have hit endgame and need someone to plink at. The game needs to change, and minor changes are needed. But as it stands I would not recommend the game. An amazing idea ruined by a terribly toxic community. Maybe ill come back to it next year. --> NOTE: No I havent don't have time. EDIT: Basically this review is beyond old, i put the damn disclaimer in. Additionally now that it has been years since I have played but I have managed to watch some playthroughs of random people, stimpee is one example go sub to the man, the issue of the game and many like it seems to be that the game lacks a real PVE aspect where the enviorment is any threat at all. Sure you get helicopters and now player placed turrets and guards, but thats really a null threat in the end as you get better, and generally they can be avoided. But there were ideas early on to make the world truly threatening and even terrifying. This makes all raides a double gambit. Imagine if firing guns causes some kind of mechanical construct to come to the area eventually. Or mutated animated stone or something. The sky is the limit. But it would mean that all PVP actions are bringing to the game extra content. In a way this means that areas "dominated" by players will become high tier areas. There is huge threat there, and there is also huge payoff there with additional end game content and items and challanges. This then frees up areas around the region for people to build up and deters nakeds from entering this area. As said before a lack of ability to hide your items is also very important. It means that when you are raiding, you are raiding. When you are mining, you are mining. When you are armed... you are armed and everyone knows it. The game doesnt need to be a toxic hellscape full of prepuberty squekers who just want to take out their adhd on something. But maybe thats exactly what the game was meant to be.

description: The only aim in Rust is to survive. Everything wants you to die - the island’s wildlife and other inhabitants, the environment, other survivors. Do whatever it takes to last another night.
name: Rust
review: Ok so played this game a ton and enjoyed past versions but the way it is now and at final release is terrible. The devs have purposfully made it so you cannot enjoy this game as a new player and in my opinion taken away the essence of rust and made it just a longer term battle royale game for the following reasons 1. Impossible as a solo player unless you play on a dead server or a solo only server (which just go play a farming sim in that case) you will most likely never see or touch a gun as the large groups of expierienced players will kill you every 2-3 steps and due to them nerfing the bow and spear (the only obtainable weps for you) it is highly unlikely you will kill any of them 2. The game is so old and toxic that finding a solid group requires either slaving for 100+hours or geting extreemly lucky because most established groups kill on sight 3 Its not what made rust popular anymore in the since that no one talks over vaciinity mic. Which means people will not communicate with you besides the "haha get owned bitch" that occures after 4 of them shoot you to death as you try to eek together enough wood for a spear 4. Because no one uses the mic anymore the community aspect of the game has deteriorated. People used to help newbies and and least say a few things before the shots ring out.. the only thing you should expect to hear from other players is a gunshot sound followed by your screen going black And to those trolls who are undoubtly going to say "mad cause your just bad" I played the full expierience was in a succesfull clan for ahwile and solo'd to some degree of success for the last year or so. My point is not that the games to difficult its that its unfair and if you happen to be a FPS god you will have much more fun on other games. But if your thinking about buying this game without ever playing it b4 i strongly suggest you save your wallet. Ive got 800+hours in this game and wish i could return it now

description: The only aim in Rust is to survive. Everything wants you to die - the island’s wildlife and other inhabitants, the environment, other survivors. Do whatever it takes to last another night.
name: Rust
review: SCRIPTS KILLING GAME FACEPUNCH DON'T CARE ENOUGH Rust is a brilliant game which I have put over 2,000 hours into, there is a ton of stuff to learn about the game which should keep you interested for well over a thousand hours just having fun. Then if you have the patience you will learn to grind and 'farm' monuments enjoying some pve for high tier loot and hopefully fighting off any counters. You may even learn to control some of the spray on the various guns but inevitabely unless you are WILLING TO CHEAT to get ahead you will end up never becoming more than a mediocre player. Why you ask? Well after burying nearly 2k hrs into the game I met some well known top tier players through a friend of mine, and after some time and trust I was advised that in order to level the playing field, I download scripts costing £15. These scripts have a key bind for specific weapons and the player only engages them when needed. These top level players are successfully scripting on a daily basis on the larger servers, destroying kids with AK assault rifles, stream sniping and genuinely being proud of themselves. BLURGH After the 2k hours I have put into this game which I loved and becoming what I would call a half decent player, this new information has completely killed this game for me. I never cheated on duke nukem back in the day and I sure as sh!t won't be starting now. Why am I quitting the game now? Rust is a survival game, if you die you lose your gear - lose your hours. As someone that wont cheat out of principle and the way it would make me feel, I cant bring myself to play a game where my 2k hours and hard practice can be levelled flat by the purchase of a fricking script. I will not lose one more hour on a playing field so distorted with dire consequences to me facing unfair fights. Save your money and your time. FACEPUNCH FIX IT please. This COULD be one of the greatest games of all time.

description: The only aim in Rust is to survive. Everything wants you to die - the island’s wildlife and other inhabitants, the environment, other survivors. Do whatever it takes to last another night.
name: Rust
review: 456 Hours of Rust at this time. Here comes my review on the game in it's current state: Rust is an amazing game, one of, if not the best survival games on Steam right now. But the thing that drives everyone, literally fucking everyone away from it, is it's community. The community in Rust is quite possible the most toxic and unfair group of people you will ever lay your eyes upon and you might truly think they all deserve to die, they might. On modded servers where you don't have to farm for an hour before you're able to even think of getting a base, still, it's nigh impossible to play without a group of 4 people or more because you will be demolished by every squeaker who gets a waterpipe regardless of skill. Now on vanilla servers....where the gather rate is NORMAL....there comes to issue of a broken keyboard/monitor etc. you will be out alone for a VERY long time and the second you run into one person with better things than you, you have to start over ALL. OVER. AGAIN. It's very repetitive unless you have a group of your closest friends to play with you so you don't get destroyed. On the decent side, again, Rust is a very amazing game without the community, with great building systems, radtowns to find loot, and an amazing world to explore. But once more, stay away from this game until the community grows up and finally finishes 3rd grade, or you have a group of friends to enjoy the game with you.

description: The only aim in Rust is to survive. Everything wants you to die - the island’s wildlife and other inhabitants, the environment, other survivors. Do whatever it takes to last another night.
name: Rust
review: Rust I've played since 2015, so I'm not a veteran in this game. Rust used to be great, but it's just gotten worse and worse. Positives: The game looks really good. The devs update every month. Fun interactions with other players if they don't shoot you in the head. Creative base-building. Great PvP-system. Negatives: First off is the community, which is probably the worst one out there. The devs encourage zergs, so there is no point in playing solo, because everyone is toxic, childish and an upright crackhead. Official servers are the most popular, but they are filled with hackers, so no need to play there. Community servers are better, but people leave them after a couple of days because of griefing, and the current "blueprint" and component system being a punishment, not a reward. The main problem I have with the devs is that once they fix something, they find something else to intentionally fuck up. They made the component system better, but then introduced the ability to let other players build on your base. Great. They started making the current system better, then introduced an upkeep system. This basically means you have to divorce your wife, quit your job and move back to your mother's basement in order to play the game, because you have to be on everyday maintaining your base. When I started playing you had a pure blueprint system, which was more or less flawless. It was completely random what blueprints you could get. The only grind was farming resources. Simple, progressive, fun. Now when you start you'll farm resources to build your base. Then you farm resources to upkeep your base. Then you farm components so you can create items. Then you farm scrap so you can research whatever you find and craft it aga-- scratch that, you have to prioritize having the scrap go towards something called a workbench, which is expensive as balls. Once you've made the three different workbenches, you can start researching items. Then you farm these amazing blueprints you find in the world, which includes game changing items like a rug, a table and a chair. When you finally get a hazmat suit, you'll explore the launchsite. If you're lucky you won't face a 15 man zerg there, and get to the top. There you'll find these amazing elite crates which contains super items like the chainlink fence, gears and an SMG body. I. CALL. WORTH. Would be logical to expect a solid base after investing 10-20 hours over a weekend, right? No problem. Just remember to log on every day for the next month to farm more resources so your base doesn't despawn because of a ridiculous upkeep system. I could go on and on about the problems this game currently has, and trust me, there's plenty. So should you buy it? Nope. This game recently came out of early access, which means the devs are very happy with the state and directon of the game. Just know this, paying 30£ for the game goes directly to the head dev researching the state of spoiled pickles over the course of a year. Amazing. Score: 4/10 Verdict: Stay away EDIT February 9th: Added score

description: The only aim in Rust is to survive. Everything wants you to die - the island’s wildlife and other inhabitants, the environment, other survivors. Do whatever it takes to last another night.
name: Rust
review: So I know what you're thinking. Another negative game review for a game that is getting great press. How could this person be so ignorant of the majesty that is RUST? However, there is a specific reason I'm giving this game thumbs down. It will not go anywhere, it will take your 20 bucks unless you get it on sale, and say thank you for your money, and it will leave you feeling in some way molested after the experience of playing it for a few days. Let me first start off by saying the game is fairly well put together as far as it’s landscape. The game map has very few clipping issues, or pit falls that will leave you stuck, and unable to retrieve your gear if you can get back to your gear before it disappears. The higher end guns and ammunitions work fairly well together, and the graphics are pretty good up to this point in the games development, so I can’t give it bad marks in these regards. With that said I must commence with the game breaking negatives this game has to offer. After a few romps around different servers it has become clear that the game engine of this game is so full of security holes it could be used as a cheese grater. What could have been an awesome game has been reduced down to a slew of game cracking trolls that spend their time finding exploits to the game that allow them to fly, summon in anything they want, and know exactly were you are on the map at all times so that they can kill you and laugh. After reading up on the web about this wonderful game breaking experience, I was sad to see that the game engine used for the game is the cause of this slew of security problems. In short, the game designers would have to completely port this game over to another game engine just to fix the issue of hackers galore. Meaning they would have to start from scratch. This game is in Alpha stage, and I understand that the company still can say that it’s in Alpha stage and it will still have problems. The issue is the game will stay in Alpha stage. The majority of people that want/wanted to play this game have come and gone, the player base has been destroyed. For a game that is to be a multi player game it will not have the multi player community after it’s all said and done. Please, I beg of anyone thinking about playing this game to just say no. If you want to end up either dropping the game after a few days of play, or turning into a Troll, please stay clear of RUST. In truth please stay clear of any game that says ALPHA in its description. At least with a BETA game you can say it’s past the majority of its development issues. I don’t care what age, race, or gender you are. It’s your responsibility as the player to put a stop to game companies wanting to get the juice out of a lemon before it’s ripe. And in the case of RUST I will chalk this game up as a learning experience. Edited 7/3/2014 OK, so I have to give the makers of this game major Brownie Points. they're actualy going to restart the game over on another game engine. Seriously this takes big man tenders to actualy accept the fact your product isn't going to work, and put forth the effort to fix it. Hats off to you guys working on this game, but still until the new release commes out, and it proves to be a lot more stable I'm going to keep this review up on your site. maybe some day I'll switch it over to a recommended.
